title: Basketball
description: Michael and his staff challenge the warehouse workers to a basketball game with a bet looming over both parties.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Jim] Hey, you ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, all right, secret sign. Hey, Ryan. [Ryan holds up his bag] Very good. Excellent, excellent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today at lunchtime we're going to be playing the warehouse staff at a friendly little game of basketball. My idea.  Last time I was down there, I noticed they'd put up a couple of hoops, and I play basketball every weekend. So I thought, "This might be kinda fun."  And so I started messing around and... I'm sinking a few, you know. Swish, swish, swish. Nothing but net. And their jaws just dropped to the floor. African-Americans! So... you know, it's really just a good friendly game, a reason to get together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, Pam, thank you ma'am. Messages, please. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, can I talk to you, please? Privately? In your office? I think I should be on the team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. And that's not me being mean, Dwight. That is based on your past behavior.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to camera] When I let him come to my pick-up game...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I apologized for that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Dwight] I vouched for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I vouched for you in front of Todd Packer, Dwight.  All right, here's what I'm going to do. The hand strikes and gives a flower. You are not going to play basketball. But I need somebody to come in and take over the holiday and weekend work calendar.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can handle that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Excellent, it'll be fun. Because corporate, uh, wants someone to be here on Saturday. And so we're going to have to have some people come in on the weekend, and I know nobody's gonna want to do it and I know everybody's gonna complain and bitch and I don't want to have to deal with that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And that's why you have an assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is. Assistant to  the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to camera] Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's not. It's lower, so...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's close.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So we need someone to work this Saturday and I think that, that should be...Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: God, this is so sad. This is the smallest amount of power I've ever seen go to someone's head. Phyllis, can you believe this?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Keep me out of it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My fiance has plans for us this Saturday.  So I really hope that Dwight doesn't make me work. Maybe I should sleep with him? I'm kidding, kidding. Totally kidding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, managing by walking around. This is our warehouse. Or, as I like to call it, the whorehouse. But don't you call it that, I've earned the right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fine, don't worry about that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And here we have "Mister Roger's Neighborhood." Come on over here. Hey, this is Ryan. He's temping upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And this is the foreman. Mista Ra-jahs.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not my real name.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's Darryl. Darryl is Mista Ra-jahs.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Darryl Rogers?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Darryl Philbin. Then Regis, then Rege, then Roger, then Mister Rogers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] And that is Lonny. And this is Roy. Roy dates Pam. You know, the uh, the best looking one upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You still getting it regular man? Huh? I mean, I can tell her it's part of the job!  Rapport!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] No, no, I know that the warranty's expired, but isn't it supposed to last longer than two years if it isn't defective? OK, fine, three years.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam gets a little down.  Her toaster oven broke. Um, which she got at her engagement shower. Um, for a wedding that still has yet to be set... and that was three years ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, um, one o'clock sharp and we've got a game on.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We're loading at one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I see, you're chickening out on me. You're bailing on me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, we got a truck going out at 1:15. So, that's the busy time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well, I'm glad that some time is a busy time because whenever I'm down here it doesn't seem too busy to me. Oh, oh. You can dish it out, but you can't take it. OK, fine, have it your way. [clucking and dancing like a chicken]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right, fine, you know what? One o'clock.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, see you at one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we ready for the game?

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: [half-heartedly] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I... yeah, yeah. I know, grumble, grumble. But you would follow me to the ends of the earth, grumbling all the way. Like that, uh, dwarf from Lord of the Rings.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gimli.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nerd. That is why you're not on the team.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just trying to be helpful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, [in a nerdy voice] "I'll help, Elwyn Dragonslayer, uh, ten points, power sword."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, so, let's put together a starting line-up, shall we? Stanley of course.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, what do you play? Center?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why "of course"?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What's that supposed to mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I don't know. I don't remember saying that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, I heard it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, people hear a lot of things, man. Um... other starters... Me, of course. I heard it that time.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'd like to play if it's just for fun. I played basketball in school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [ignores Phyllis)] Um... Yeah. Who else? We have Jim. We have Ryan, the new guy, right? Untested. Willing to prove himself now. A lot of passion, a lot of heart.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: But, I'm getting paid to skip lunch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, this is business. The, uh, business of team building and morale boosting. Uh, who else?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I can help out, if you need me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will use your talents come baseball season, my friend. Or if we box.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I have a hoop in my driveway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have a sports bra.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, look. [Dwight throws paper at the garbage can]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Missed it...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Close. All right, uh... Me, Stan the man, Jim, Ryan and Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I be team captain?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm team captain.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I be team manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I am the team manager. You can be assistant to the team manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Assistant team manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, we'll see who's working this weekend then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, you're in charge of the vacation schedule now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Threat neutralized.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hits Pam in the head with a piece of paper] Off the backboard!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Please don't throw garbage at me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Pam with a zinger. Hey, Pam, how would you, like to be our cheerleader today? You know, some, ah, pigtails? A little, ah, halter top, you could tie that up. And you know, something a little, just, youthful, for a change. Just this once?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think so Michael. Besides, I can't cheer against my fiance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll do it. Wear a little flouncey skirt if you want, and...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I bet you would. Just try not to be too gay on the court. And by gay I mean, um, you know, not in a homosexual way at all. I mean the uh, you know, like the bad-at-sports way. I think that goes without saying.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe Angela would cheerlead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah right.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yuck, that's worse than you playing. ... 'Cause we need you as an alternate in case somebody gets hurt. That's where we need you. Blessed be those who sit and wait. You made it, suit up, you're on the team! All right, cool! Very good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh-oh. Oh-oh. A spy from the warehouse. Trying to figure out our plays, huh, man?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Just getting a tea bag.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ho, oh, he's running. He's running. He's running, but he can't hide because you know what? One o'clock, you better bring your 'A' game. Because me, and my, posse guys are gonna be in your face. Right in your face!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why don't we make it more interesting? Loser buys dinner at Farley's.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa-ho. I like the way you think. You know what, I'm gonna take that one step further. Loser, works, on Saturday.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, that's not as much fun. You know what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You're on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Cool, you're on. [to Dwight] Don't screw this up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to camera] Classic beginner's mistake, eating before a game.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Has anyone seen the first-aid kit? [Dwight holds the kit up] How many times have I told you? I'm the safety officer, not you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Basketball? It was kind of my thing in high school. And I'm, yeah, I'm looking forward to playing. You know, I think I'm gonna impress a few people in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You coming down?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm just forwarding the phones.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You gonna wish me luck?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, you're gonna need it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that trash talk from Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughing] I'm just saying, Roy is very competitive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And he wants to take the WaveRunners to the lake this Saturday so...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I'm going to the outlet mall on Saturday, so if you wanna save big on brand names and Roy has to work, which he will, because I'm also competitive, you should feel free to come along.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I think I'm gonna be up at the lake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I'll see you at the mall. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, there he is! Secret weapon! All right, guys, come on, let's bring it in! Here we go!  OK, listen, this is just going to be a friendly game, right? We are all on the same team here, the Dunder Mifflin team. Of course, if you beat us, you're fired. That's a joke.  OK, let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Have a good game man.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, you too. Should be fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, everybody stretch out a little bit. Stretch it. Full stretch. Ryan, you wanna stretch?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I stretched before I came.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, Ryan, you have Darryl. I have Roy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? I thought I'd take Roy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Actually, I think Roy is their best player not Lonny. So, Dwight, you uh, have the East German gal. Uh, who else we got... Um...OK, all right, you guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [taking off his shirt] OK, we'll be skins!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aw, come on Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Shirts on or off?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On. Just put it on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Uh, Pam? You kind of have your foot in both camps, why don't you do the uh, jump ball OK?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Don't listen to him Pam. Trust me, tip it my way or you're sleeping in the car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley!  What? You gotta be kidding me! !?! [Roy steals the ball, and goes for a lay up] Oh... Here we go! [Lonny shoots and makes it] Who's on him? Somebody get him!

quotes.speaker: Teammates
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: That's what I'm talking about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Over here, over here. [Jim saves the ball from going out of bounds and passes to Michael] Here we go. Three! [Shoots and misses] Let's go to the zone! We're going to zone!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: De-fense! [clap, clap] [Michael joins in] De-fense! [clap clap]

quotes.speaker: {michael} and {dwight}
quotes.text: De-fense! De-fense!

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Worker
quotes.text: [Roy scores] Well done team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's got Roy? [Jim does a behind the back move around Roy for the basket]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Woo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [misses a half court shot] Aw, come on! What is wrong with me today!? Usually hit those. [Dwight scores] Dwight, I was open. All right, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Roy bumps Michael to get around him] OK, foul. Charging. Charging. That's a foul.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, I'll take it. [misses free throw] OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I am playing hoops all of the stress and responsibility of my job here just melts away. It's gone, I'm in the zone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [misses another shot] What is wrong with me today?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who am I? Am I Michael Scott? I don't know... I might just be a basketball machine. What's Dunder Mifflin? I've never heard of it. Filing? Paperwork? Who cares? Possible downsizing? Um... well, that's probably gonna happen, actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim! Jim! Jim, right here, Jim! Give me the ball! Ryan, cut! [Michael looks away and misses Jim's pass] Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My bad.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [scores] Here we go. Here we go. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: [dancing] Where you at? Where you at? You over there? I'm over there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is cool. Is that like the Robot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Ryan scores] Nice! Come here! [gives Ryan a chest bump]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can we just do one? That's cool, that's fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You have one more free throw shoot. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: All right, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Worker
quotes.text: Watch your back Madge.

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: Hey! Come on man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on! Hey, Dwight. Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scores] Yeah! [points to Madge] In your face!

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: Yeah, like that counts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Dwight, Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Football is like rock and roll, it's just bam-bam-boo... And basketball is like jazz, you know? You're kind of... Dupee-doo, dupee-do. It's all downbeat, it's in the pocket, it's like... [singing] Dupee-do, dupee-do, dapee-dah...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Du-du-du-du-dupee-do, de-do-do-do. Du-du-du-du-dupee-do, de-do-do-do. Harlem Globetrotter...

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [steals the ball, scores, mimics singing] Du-du-du-du-dupee-do. Your ball.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, time, time out. Come on, sales, over here. Bring it in! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's going on? What's going on? You're playing like a bunch of girls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? Let me take Roy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, switch. Take it up a notch, come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shoot, shoot it.  [Roy hits Jim in the mouth with his elbow] Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Foul! Naked aggression!  Oh, that is... You all right Jim? Suck it up.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Block, block, block!

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: He's afraid of you now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jim makes a shot after pushing off Roy] Ouch! Oh, how much does it hurt? How much does it hurt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jim pushes Roy to the ground and makes another shot] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What the hell man?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Take it easy.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, you take it easy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Darryl scores] Watch the long passes, you guys!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [Dwight steals the ball from Ryan] Same team, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scores] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Phyllis scores] Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! In, your, face! Angela, what's the score?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You're ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, baby, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jim has the ball] Jim! Jim! Right here! [runs into the elbow of the guy guarding him] Ow! God! Hold it!

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Foul! Foul!

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: I'm sorry. You all right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that hurts.

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: Sorry, I didn't mean to do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's your problem man? Gah, just clocking me for no reason?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Take your shot man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. That was a flagrant, personal, intentional foul. Right there.

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: No it wasn't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mocking voice] Yes, it was. You know what, I'm just being fair.

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: Oh, really? No, I just put my arm up...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Game over. Game over. That is it! I'm sorry, you know? I hate to do it this way but, you know, that's just... we're having a friendly game. It's a shame. This is a damn shame, but we're like a family here and that just, that won't fly.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is a cold pack...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here, give me that. You have to break the interior bag. [bag explodes]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Wait, what does that mean? What is it, a tie? What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, let's just say whoever was ahead won.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That was you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was us? Really? I didn't, I didn't know. Great, I mean, I guess you guys are working Saturday. Your face.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, no, no, I'm not coming in on Saturday.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, this isn't happening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um... well, you guys, you know, I'm the boss so...

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: So what's that? We're coming in on Monday, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey...

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Monday?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] You guys believed me? Come on. Dogs, you know, you should know me better than that. No, oh, do you think that would've been good for morale? No. No. No. Exactly, no. I'm embarrassed it was even that close though. So... nah, of course, we're coming in Saturday. Good game. Word.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] ...so I talked to the scout, it looks good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn't sign anything.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey baby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [to Jim] Look at Larry Bird. Larry Legend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he's, uh, pretty good, huh? [to Roy] Let's get you into a tub.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah? Let's get you into a tub.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what a game, huh? What a game.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What time do we have to come in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. Let's not be gloomy here man. We're all in this together. We're a team. You know what? Screw corporate, nobody's coming in tomorrow. You have the day off. Like coming in an extra day is gonna prevent us from being downsized. Have a good weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The great thing about sports is that it is all about character. And you can learn lessons about life even if you don't win. But we did because we were ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [slams palms on desk] Pam, Pam, thank you ma'am. Messages, please. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: New pants?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, yes. Thank you for noticing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Abercrombie & Fitch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, they look that good? Wow. [Mike Myers voice] Oh, Pam please behave. Mike Myers, genius. Um, no actually I got them at a fancier place. Target.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, could I talk to you for a second, please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In your office? [in Michael's office] You know that is why you have an assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes. Assistant to  the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to camera] Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's not. It's lower.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That look?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What look?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like trying to find the camera, to give the camera a look. Okay, we're done. Is that your stomach? I keep hearing somebody's stomach. [whispers] God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, you uh, see the Sixers game last night?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [howls like a wolf] Oww whoo whoo! The Answer was on fire!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Iverson. Yeah, always man. It's very important.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, man! Man I tell ya. Iverson has maybe got me beat by like 20 pounds, 3 inches. [makes 'pop' noise with his mouth]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What? Iverson's not fat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, neither am I. We both look good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I have a nickname on the court, um? Well, The Answer would be nice, but it's taken. So, uh, probably The Question. The Answer dishes to The Question. The Question back to The Answer. Answer over to The Question. The Answer, whew, [makes shooting motion] three points. The Question, whew, whew, [makes shooting motion] six points. Nothing but net. Question, who's the best player in the league? Answer, The Question. Or the Drunkmeister.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can't work Saturday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, have a seat. [Kevin sits down] Okay, why not?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm in a band.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Marching or garage?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's a Steve Miller Tribute Band.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I tell you what. You give me a tape of your band and a tape of the Steve Miller Band and I'll get back to you. That is all.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Mello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Packer. Pac-man.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Whoa. Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pac-man [imitating the noises of the video game Pac-man eating dots]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Is this Michael Scott? My secret lover. My intercom, I told you never to call me here. Never! [Michael's laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not your lover! I'm am not Michael Scott, I am Dr. Bergerstein. Your proctologist.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Bergerstein!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, yes. Ah. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Bergerstein!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not a Jewish joke, so don't worry.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] I want my money back you greedy Hebrew. Bergerstein!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] No, hey, hey , hey. You know what I just wanted to remind you about the game today. One 'o clock. Big game, big game.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [sounds sick on the phone] I can't make it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm. No, you said you could man. We're counting on ya. You know you're playing point guard.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] I... I'm not coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Hey... I mean, although it's just for fun, you know we want... I was counting on you man.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Oh, God! Stop whining. You know, you only come to the pick up game once a year. You little bitch. [Michael picks up phone, takes it off speakerphone] All right, yup. Hey, okay. No problem, you know, best you can do. Hey, you know. Hey, nice talking to you too. All right take care. [sighs] Michael Scoot. That's funny. He's a good friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [eating Tootsie Rolls from Angela's candy on her desk] Mmm. Good. Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: They're one per person. [points to sign "Please take one!!]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Would you like to have a vacation this year? That's what I thought. [continues eating Tootsie Rolls] Mmm, delicious.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I though we were saving money for the wedding, but apparently Roy thought it was more important to buy two WaveRunners. I don't really ever get to use the other WaveRunner that's supposed to be mine because his brother uses it and they race.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, you're the new schedule guy, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm trying, yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I hear that. You know what? This little baby might come in handy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On one condition. You...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Forget it. It's just a dry erase board.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no it's not. Okay, check it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, that's insanely complicated and the first thing I'm going to do is erase it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you're not because I spent hours on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, then keep it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I will. Okay, fine. You'll be back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [misses a  free throw badly] I... I think you can play. Like you could when you were a kid. I think you can never give up the play. Because if people stop playing, then they stop living. It's like a shark. If a shark stops playing he stops living. And sharks are very playful creatures.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Dwight holds the first aid kit up] I'm the safety officer, not you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Isn't that crazy? I'm a Volunteer Sheriff's Deputy. Lackawanna County says that it's okay for me to perform CPR, but for Michael my lips aren't qualified enough for his perfect little face. It's nuts.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is that really necessary?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [wearing a face guard] I've almost had my nose broken a dozen times.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Worker
quotes.text: [back to the basketball game] Let's go Lonny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Michael steals the ball] Yeah, Michael. Go Michael. [makes shot]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Birdie. He's not the guy with the cheeks. Kenny G. Is... if you knew jazz, you'd know who I mean. Kenny G. God. Glad I remembered that. Jazz people know who he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [back to the basketball game] Dwight, pass it to Jim! Pass it to Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, my ankle!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley, gotta play hurt.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, actually no I don't Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just want you know, you've been a big disappointment to me today, okay.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [in pain] Oh. Go away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm in. I'm in. Here we go. [Lonny gets around Michael to score and he ends up in front of Phyllis] Zone, Phyllis! We're playing zone!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Kevin makes seven straight shots from the free throw line]

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: [Michael hits a half court shot] Ah! [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! Yes! All right. We got game!
